articles.title: U.S. Secretary of State leaves
articles.content:
U.S. Secretary of State leaves 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- Madeleine K. Albright, Secretary of State of the United States of America, together with her suite members, left here today after visiting the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
 She was seen off at the airport by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of foreign affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Turkish party delegation arrives
articles.content:
Turkish party delegation arrives 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Turkey headed by Dogu Ferincek, chairman of its central committee, arrived here yesterday by air.

Agreements signed between DPRK and Romanian governments
articles.content:
Agreements signed between DPRK and Romanian governments 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- An agreement on trade, economic cooperation and payment and an agreement on the formation of a joint economic and scientific and technological consultative committee between the DPRK and romanian governments were signed in bucharest on Oct. 19.
 The DPRK ambassador to Romania and the Romanian Minister of Commerce and Industry signed the agreements upon the authorization of their governments.

Wreaths laid at cemetery of fallen CPV fighters
articles.content:
Wreaths laid at cemetery of fallen CPV fighters 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The high-ranking military delegation of China led by colonel general Chi Haotian, vice-chairman of the central military commission of the People's Republic of China, state councillor and Minister of National Defence, yesterday laid wreaths at the grave of Mao Anying and cemetery of the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers in Hoechang county, south Phyongan Province, in the name of the delegation on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the CPV entry into the Korean front.
 Present there were colonel general Ri Pyong Sam, lieut. gen. Pak Sung Won, generals and officers of the Korean People's  Army,  Chinese ambassador to the DPRK Wang Guozhang and military attache of the Chinese embassy Yan Jiangfeng.    
 On the same day the wreaths in the name of the Chinese embassy here were also laid.

Chinese delegation lays wreath at Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese delegation lays wreath at Friendship Tower 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The high-ranking military delegation of the People's Republic of China (PRC) headed by colonel general Chi Haotian, vice-chairman of the central military commission of the PRC, state councillor and Minister of National Defence, today laid a wreath in its name at the friendship tower on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
 Present there were vice marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces, colonel general Ri Pyong Sam, generals and officers of the KPA, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK Wang Guozhang and military attache of the Chinese embassy here Yan Jiangfeng.    
 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen fighters of the Chinese people's volunteers.

Kim Jong Il sends wreath to Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to Friendship Tower 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the Friendship Tower here on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front.
 The wreath was laid at the tower today.    
 Written on the ribbon hanging from the wreath were letters "Glory to Fallen Figthers of the Chinese People's Volunteers "
